meanings.definition: Used as a respectful form of address to a group of male judges or noblemen.
meanings.sent1: Milords, may I present the evidence for your consideration?
meanings.sent2: The king addressed the milords in the court with great respect.
meanings.sent3: Milords, please do not forget to bring your gavels to the royal tea party.
meanings.sent4: The milords of the court were like wise owls, observing every detail.
meanings.sent5: The word 'milords' echoed through the grand hall, signifying authority and respect.

meanings.definition: Used as a term of address to a group of male authority figures.
meanings.sent1: Milords, we seek your guidance on this important matter.
meanings.sent2: Milords, the council meeting will commence shortly.
meanings.sent3: Milords, the royal cat has declared a rebellion against the mice!
meanings.sent4: The storm raged outside, but the milords remained calm and composed.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the milords gathered to discuss matters of the kingdom.
